description: [UN News] A potentially "groundbreaking" new test for tuberculosis (TB) has been endorsed by the UN World Health Organization (WHO) as part of continuing efforts to eradicate one of the planet's leading infectious killers.
title: Africa: UN Health Agency Approves 'Groundbreaking' TB Test

description: [Mastercard Foundation] December 4, 2024. Cape Town, South Africa -- A new study calls for domiciling investment vehicles in Africa. It argues that mobilizing the flow of investment capital to African-based investment vehicles (IVs) will contribute to economic growth, job creation and inclusive business opportunities for young people on the continent.
title: Africa: New Study Reveals Domiciliation As Key to Mobilizing Capital Flows in Africa

description: [WHO] Geneva -- The World Health Organization (WHO) has granted prequalification to the molecular diagnostic test for tuberculosis (TB) called Xpert® MTB/RIF Ultra. It is the first test for TB diagnosis and antibiotic susceptibility testing that meets WHO's prequalification standards.
title: Africa: WHO Announces First Prequalification of a Tuberculosis Diagnostic Test

description: [UNCCD] Riyadh, Saudi Arabia -- Yesterday, hundreds of private sector representatives from finance, fashion, agri-food to pharmaceuticals, convened in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, to discuss their role in ensuring sustainable land, soil and water management. They responded to a call to action launched by the United Nations Convention to Combat Desertification (UNCCD) at the 16th Conference of the Parties.
title: Africa: Private Sector Urged to Step Up Investment in Healthy Lands

description: [ISS] Amid growing concerns, Kenya needs evidence-based regulations to balance public health and economic interests.
title: Africa: Kenya Strives to Strike a Balance On Muguka

description: [UN News] There have been significant advances in addressing the worldwide internal displacement crisis, but urgent action is still needed as numbers continue to rise, topping 76 million people worldwide, the top UN official on the issue said on Wednesday.
title: Africa: 'Major Milestone' On Solutions to Internal Displacement - Top Adviser

description: [Liberian Observer] The Ministry of Commerce and Industry, in partnership with the International Trade Center, has launched a nationwide campaign to raise awareness and educate the public on the African Continental Free Trade Area (AfCFTA). This initiative aims to inform participants about the benefits and opportunities that the AfCFTA offers for trade within Africa.
title: Africa: MOC Embarks On AfCFTA Awareness, Sensitization Nationwide

description: [Premium Times] The thing about bad behaviour, when it is legitimised, is that it becomes the standard that human beings want to aspire to.
title: Africa: Biden, American Hypocrisy and the Rule of Law, By Cheta Nwanze

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The African Union Commission Chairperson, Moussa Faki, has applauded the peaceful and historic elections in Namibia, following the election of Netumbo Nandi-Ndaitwah as the country's first female president in polls held on November 27.
title: Africa: Faki Hails Namibia's for Peaceful and Historic Election

description: [New Times] Africa has become the prime investor destination in the race for returns in the global energy transition growth, said the President of the African Development Bank Group, Akinwumi Adesina.
title: Africa: Africa Is Prime Investment Destination for Energy Transition - AfDB's Adesina

description: [allAfrica] When I recently visited a hospital ward in Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo, I left feeling deeply distraught. Over a dozen patients with HIV were admitted with cryptococcal meningitis - a fungal disease which is the second-leading cause of HIV- related death. Many were diagnosed late, which meant this disease, which causes excruciating headaches, fever and neck stiffness, had advanced so much it was increasingly difficult to treat them. To make things worse, the lifesaving treatment for
title: Africa: World AIDS Day - This Is How We Can Fight the Second Biggest Killer of People with HIV

description: [Nile Post] The Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC), in collaboration with the African Union (AU), has unveiled the Lusaka Agenda, a bold initiative aimed at achieving Universal Health Coverage (UHC) across the continent.
title: Africa: Africa CDC and AU Launch Lusaka Agenda to Advance Universal Health Coverage

description: [IFAD] New IFAD case study in Mali shows diaspora finance and investment play an essential role in helping vulnerable populations adapt to climate change
title: Africa: Money Sent Home by Relatives Is Vital for Families in Sub-Saharan Africa to Withstand the Impact of Climate Change

description: [GAVI] A decade after the deadliest Ebola outbreak in history, Sierra Leone begins a new chapter with nation-wide preventive vaccination of frontline workers
title: Africa: Sierra Leone Launches Ebola Vaccination for Frontline Workers

description: [Vanguard] ...AS oil marketers seek to patronize Port Harcourt Refinery
title: West Africa: Dangote, Port Harcourt, Others Drive Competition in West Africa - Expert

description: [World Bank] Bangui -- According to a World Bank report published today, the Central African economy has remained stagnant, with GDP growth estimated to register 0.7% in 2024, before gradually rebounding to around 1.6% on average between 2025 and 2026. This period of stagnation is due primarily to the repeated fuel shortages experienced since 2022 and to the severe power outages that have occurred in Bangui throughout at least the first half of 2024.
title: Africa: Designing Fiscal Instruments for Sustainable Forestry and Economic Growth

description: [VOA] Nairobi, Kenya -- Businesses started by women have received less than 5% of venture capital funding in Africa over the past decade, according to a new report. The report says investment in female-started businesses decreased further last year, frustrating businesswomen and those who want investors to give them greater consideration.
title: Africa: Africa's Women-Led Startups Struggle to Find Investors

description: [VOA] Nairobi -- Forty-three out of 50 countries and territories in sub-Saharan Africa have "restricted" or "shut down" civic spaces, according to a report released Wednesday by a global alliance of civil society organizations.
title: Africa: Africa's Civic Space Remains Mostly Repressive - Report

description: [Global Witness] Fossil fuels have kicked the Global Plastics Treaty down the road. The next session must drown out their schemes by heeding activist and Indigenous voices
title: Africa: Global Plastics Treaty Must Be Shored Up Against Oil and Gas Ambitions

description: [World Bank] Bangui -- New World Bank report highlights the urgency for the Central African Republic (CAR) to build resilience to climate change and curb poverty, which could increase by 3% in urban areas and 6% in rural areas respectively by 2050.
title: Africa: New Report Calls for Urgent Action to Build a Resilient Future in Central African Republic

description: [VOA] Washington -- Amid widespread protests in Kenya this summer over a controversial finance bill, the country's Communications Authority announced it did not intend to shut down internet access. The next day, however, Kenya experienced a countrywide loss in internet connectivity.
title: Africa: Analysts Troubled By Trend of Internet, Social Media Shutdowns in Africa

description: [CFR] Contrary to doomsayers, liberal democracy is building up a head of steam on the continent.
title: Africa: Africa's Democratic Momentum

description: [UNHCR] Officials from SADC Member States join UNHCR and partners to discuss implementation of the "route-based approach" strategy, agree to enhance collaboration
title: Southern Africa: Governments Commit to Strengthening Regional Responses for Refugees and Migrants Along Routes in Southern Africa

description: [IPS] This time last year, the forestry space was abuzz with news of the big Blue Carbon deals. The deals set  a staggering amount of land in Sub-Saharan Africa - 20% of the land in Zimbabwe, 10% of Liberia and Zambia, 8% of Tanzania, and an undisclosed amount of land in Kenya - to be managed by a firm in the United Arab Emirates.
title: Africa: After Gaps in UN Agreement, National Laws Must Step Up to Protect Community Land Rights

description: [The New Humanitarian] Berhale/Johannesburg -- "The UN deploys where there is peace to be kept, African-led PSOs deploy where there is no peace at all."
title: Africa: African-Led Peacekeeping Fills a UN-Sized Hole

description: [IPS] Urbana, Illinois, U.S. -- Recently, at the UN climate conference COP29, countries agreed to do everything necessary to invest in climate solutions to protect lives and livelihoods from worsening climate change impacts and to build a prosperous world. This is necessary. Indeed, every effort must be made by our leaders to protect lives and livelihoods.
title: Africa: Turning to Regenerative Practices and Soil Microbes to Fight Effects of Climate Change

description: [ISS] As Africa pushes for greater integration and economic development, a coordinated and better-managed migration landscape is central.
title: Africa: Africa's Migration Governance Structure Is Built Bloc By Bloc
